questions.question: How is the divergence angle of a laser beam measured practically?

answers.a: Using a ruler to measure the diameter of the laser at different distances
answers.c: By calculating the change in intensity with distance
answers.d: Measuring the beam diameter at two points and calculating the angle

questions.question: What property of a laser changes as it diverges?
Which mathematical relationship is used to calculate the divergence angle (θ) in a laser experiment?

answers.b: θ ≈ (D1 - D2) / L, where D1 and D2 are diameters at two points and L is the distance between them

questions.question: What effect does the divergence of a laser beam have on its application in long-distance measurements?
Which of the following can minimize the divergence of a laser beam?

answers.b: Passing the beam through a concave lens
